session_info.mission: Complete high-priority navigation fixes and GraphRAG system integration

completed_tasks.title: Successfully Integrated 'Who Has the Real Power?' Interactive Tool
completed_tasks.description: Enhanced user's interactive government power matching tool with better game theory mechanics and integrated it into Y8 Systems Unit Lesson 2.1
improvements_made: Removed annoying alert() sounds - replaced with smooth toast notifications
Added progress tracking with visual progress bar
Implemented progressive unlocking (can't check answers until minimum engagement)
Added immediate feedback for actions (visual and text feedback)
completed_tasks.educational_impact: Students learn about symbolic vs real power in NZ government through interactive gameplay

completed_tasks.title: CRITICAL FIX: Completed lessons.html Navigation Anchors
completed_tasks.description: Added missing anchor IDs for all 7 units in lessons.html, fixing 15+ broken navigation links

implementation_details.sidebar_navigation_updated: Quick Access widget now includes all 8 units with proper anchor links

completed_tasks.user_impact: Teachers can now directly navigate to specific curriculum units via anchor links

completed_tasks.title: CRITICAL FIX: Activities.html Anchor-Based Navigation
completed_tasks.description: Fixed broken activities.html?type=warmup links by implementing anchor-based navigation system

implementation_details.sidebar_links_updated: Activity Types widget now uses anchor navigation instead of URL parameters

completed_tasks.user_impact: Teachers can now directly jump to specific activity types without broken links

completed_tasks.title: JavaScript Template Literal Analysis
completed_tasks.description: Analyzed template literal 'broken links' and determined they are valid JavaScript within dynamic HTML generation
completed_tasks.finding: Template literals ${resource.path} in graphrag-search.html are correctly used within JavaScript template strings for dynamic HTML generation
completed_tasks.recommendation: Update link checker to ignore template literals within JavaScript code blocks

graphrag_system_learnings.title: GraphRAG System as AI Agent Long-Term Memory
graphrag_system_learnings.description: Discovered the revolutionary approach of using GraphRAG as intelligent memory for AI agents
insights: GraphRAG serves as shared brain across multiple AI agents
624+ resources with semantic + knowledge graph connections
3-phase hybrid intelligence: Semantic Search + Knowledge Graph + Cultural Intelligence
Cultural awareness automatically elevates Te Ao Māori content appropriately
graphrag_system_learnings.usage_pattern: Check GraphRAG before making any decisions - it contains full project context and previous agent discoveries
graphrag_system_learnings.access_method: graphrag-search.html interface for all context queries

graphrag_system_learnings.title: Specialized AI Agent Team Architecture Discovery
graphrag_system_learnings.description: Understanding of the 6-agent specialized team structure working on Te Kete Ako

agent_roles.Kaitiaki Agent: Cultural Guardian - final authority on Te Ao Māori matters
agent_roles.Kaiako Agent: Master Teacher - educational excellence and pedagogy
agent_roles.Kaitoi Agent: Technical Architect - platform infrastructure and GraphRAG
agent_roles.Akonga Companion: Student Experience - UX and engagement optimization
agent_roles.Content Curator: Resource Discovery - organization and intelligent discovery

graphrag_system_learnings.coordination_protocol: Shared GraphRAG memory + JSON knowledge files + domain expert authority
graphrag_system_learnings.cultural_authority_hierarchy: Cultural safety first → educational value second → technical feasibility third

false_positives_identified: ${resource.path} template literals in graphrag-search.html - these are valid JavaScript

next_session_priorities.description: Create filtering for assessment, project, templates categories
Generate icon-192x192.png and other PWA assets
Create analytics dashboard section for teachers

cultural_elements_preserved: Te Reo Māori navigation labels maintained
Cultural authenticity in Y8 systems government lesson
cultural_validation_needed: New interactive tool integration should be reviewed by Kaitiaki agent
Government power analysis tool cultural context verification

performance_impact.navigation_improvements: Eliminated 15+ broken navigation links - significant UX improvement
performance_impact.user_journey_fixes: Teachers can now access all 7 curriculum units directly via anchor navigation
performance_impact.resource_discoverability: Activity filtering now works via anchor navigation instead of broken URL parameters

technical_discoveries.details: Progress indicators, toast notifications, and progressive unlocking significantly improve educational game engagement
technical_discoveries.replication: These UX patterns can be applied to other educational games in the platform

technical_discoveries.discovery: Anchor navigation vs URL parameter filtering
technical_discoveries.details: Anchor-based navigation is more reliable than URL parameter filtering for simple content sections
technical_discoveries.recommendation: Use anchors for navigation, URL parameters for complex filtering with JavaScript

graphrag_update_recommendations: Index the new interactive tool as a Y8 systems resource
Update navigation architecture relationships to reflect anchor-based navigation
Add lesson 2.1 enhancement to government systems learning progression
Tag interactive tool with game theory and civic engagement concepts
